meanings.definition: A new or original idea or concept.
meanings.sent1: Her novum about solving climate change impressed everyone at the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The scientist presented a novum that revolutionized the field of medicine.
meanings.sent3: The novum of using chocolate as a fuel source raised some eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: His novum on time travel was so outlandish that it seemed like science fiction.
meanings.sent5: The novum of a car that runs on water captured everyone's imagination.

meanings.definition: A new or unusual thing or occurrence.
meanings.sent1: The strange novum in the sky turned out to be a rare comet.
meanings.sent2: The market was buzzing with excitement over the latest novum in technology.
meanings.sent3: Finding a talking parrot in the forest was a novum that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The novum of a purple cow wandering the streets was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The novum of a two-headed snake was both fascinating and unsettling.
